newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares set high, seen losing steam.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares set high, seen losing steam.

text.p: Polish shares set a 33-month high for the third straight session on Friday, but analysts saw them falling or at least slowing growth in a profit-taking correction early next week.
The main market's WIG index rose 1.1 percent, to 15,418.9 and turnover rose 11.5 percent to 211.6 million zlotys ($73 million) on both markets as 46 issues rose, 21 fell and 17 were flat.
"It seems there will be a kind of halt early next week, it's difficult to say whether it will mean falls or only slowing growth," said Wojciech Kossuth, an analyst at Bank Slaski brokerage.
Some analysts said they expected a fall of about two percent on Monday, but were uncertain about the market's direction later in the week.
Analysts said that in the case of a fall, 15,000 points should provide strong support for the WIG index.
Mass privatisation NFI units rose 2.7 percent in a 43.4-million-zloty ($15 million) turnover.
Pharmeceutical firm Polfa Kutno SA, Friday's top gainer, jumped 10 percent but analysts could not find a justification for such a strong gain.
Industrial boilermaker Rafako SA soared 9.9 percent in heavy 10-million-zloty ($3.4 million) trade, extending its surge on the back of Wednesday's announcement it was seeking a strategic investor.
